array.string: The two white circles at the bottom represent "experiments". Tap them to "do experiments".
Experiments generate small white circles that move up the screen called "experiences". Each experience has a numerical "value" displayed on its right.
Your score (top left) is the sum of the values of your last ten experiences. Try to reach 10 before moving on to the next level.
Experiments do not always produce the same experiences.
Experiences that have a positive value are considerred "enjoyable", and those that have a negative value "unpleasant".
Try to generate a sequence of enjoyable experiences.
You can indentify experiments by their shape, and experiences by their shape and their color.
Long-press an experiment to change its shape. This will also change the shape of the experiences produed by this experiment.
Long-press an experience to change its color. This will also change the color of the other experiences produced by the same experiment and having the same result.
In the world of Level 3, you cannot always avoid unpleasant experiences.
Just try to generate a sequence that contains as few unpleasant experiences as possible.
For help, you can display enjoyable experiences in green and unpleasant experiences in red.
Begin with looking for "persistent" experiments: experiments that always produce the same experiences when you repete them several times in a raw.
Persistent experiments allow you to "observe the state of the world" without changing it.
Then, look for experiments that generate enjoyable experiences in some particular states of the world.
Finally, look for experiments that let you change the state of the world.
Level 5 is identical to level 4, but you must choose the shapes of the experiments and the colors of the experiences yourself.
Try to find what experiments correspond to the triangle and square of Level 4, and what experiences correspond to green and red.
Replaying Level 4 may help you.
In Level 6, experiments are similar to those in Levels 4 and 5, but they transform the world on the long term, and their values are different.
